posts.title: Mobile Speed
posts.contents:
We’ve spent the past month mostly focused on stability and heavily optimizing the mobile app. Let’s get right into the details!

Mobile App

The iOS and Android apps now load much faster, especially for people with large documents. Large lists update much faster when typing and adding items, or when searching or filtering. There’s still more optimizations we can do, but this should be a big improvement for those of you with a lot of items. And we also fixed a good number of mobile bugs in general. If you’re still seeing any issues on mobile please let us know in our beta community or just email us. We will continue to focus on the mobile app for a while, so it will keep getting better.

Bug fixes

We’ve fixed a ton of small bugs over the past month with a focus on plugin sync, so sync with Google services is much more stable now. We updated the Settings to combine the plugin settings screen with the Sync Accounts screen, which feels a lot more intuitive.

Next

We are continuing to focus on stability in both the web and mobile apps, and starting on improving the introduction experience. See the changelog for the full list of updates. If there’s any particular bug that’s been bothering you or a feature that could really help you, please let us know! The best way to do that is to join our beta community or just email us.

posts.title: Linking to Items
posts.contents:
Today we have a long requested new feature, inter-item linking, to link to other Moo.do items. With this, you can track dependencies or group multiple disparate items together. It even works between documents! We’ve been beta testing this for a couple of weeks and we are excited to release it to everyone and see how people use it. If you have any ideas for how this can better improve your workflow, please let us know!

Simply type [[ (two brackets) to bring up autocompletion to select an item to link to.

Bug fixes

We are still continuing to focus on stability and bug fixing in both the web and mobile apps. See the changelog for the full list of updates. If there’s any particular bug that’s been bothering you or a feature that could really help you, please let us know! The best way to do that is to join our beta community or just email us.

posts.title: Editing Improvements
posts.contents:
For the past month we’ve been focused on improving stability. Most notably we concentrated on making sure document sync is rock solid, and we’ve fixed some minor sync issues that some users were facing with the Google Calendar and Gmail plugins. With the sync problems behind us we did some major work on the editing experience.

Text editing

In this update we rewrote the core text parsing, measuring, rendering, and editing engine. This is a big improvement overall and lets us more easily expand the capabilities of the text editor, and brings some significant upgrades:


  • FeatureExport to HTML and plain text
  • FeatureFormatting text with bold, italic, and underline generally work much better
  • FixWhen pressing + K to open the link editor while the cursor is inside a link, it will edit the link
  • FixPressing enter in the middle of formatted text now splits the text correctly
  • FixCopying from Moo.do to paste into other apps is generally formatted better
  • FixAdding text after a link was sometimes not working
  • FixExport including archived items works better
  • SpeedLoad time and general editing performance improved

Next up

We’re continuing to focus on stability and bug-fixing. If there’s any particular bug that’s been bothering you or a feature that could really help you, please let us know! The best way to do that is to join our beta community or just email us.

posts.title: Desktop Panes
posts.contents:
Our past year has been consumed by two massive projects, the new backend and the new mobile apps. Now that they’re done, we’re taking a break from big projects to focus on stability and improving the quality of our current features. In the past month we’ve fixed a ton of bugs and we’ve been beta testing a change to the layout of the pane header along with new ways of grouping and sorting your data.

Pane Design and Features

We’ve rearranged the pane header and menus to be more intuitive. The top row of the header now prominently displays the document name and the name of the item you’re zoomed into, with the breadcrumb path lightly displayed above it. The bottom row has a button for setting up the pane view options and a full width search bar.

The pane view options bring new possibilities:

  • The Created and Completed grouping/sort modes are now top level options. They were previously sort modes under the Agenda view.
  • You can now group and sort by modified time.
  • All of the groupings and sorts can now be viewed as a “List” view, which shows only the items that match the search with no hierarchy.

Improved search

Along with the new groupings and sort modes, search has new features to make it more powerful.

  • Quoted phrase search like word1 "quoted phrase" -"hide phrase"
  • Search for * to match starred items, !!! to match priority items, ^ or # to match projects
  • Search for date:today+<num> to show items <num> days from today

Combining these new search features with “or” searches can make for some really powerful filtering!

Miscellaneous

We’ve also been fixing bugs and adding little features that our users have requested. See the changelog for a full rundown of all the fixes/features.

If there’s any particular bug that’s been bothering you or a feature that could really help you, please let us know! The best way to do that is to join our beta community or just email us.

Next up

We’ll be continuing to focus on stability and bug-fixing to make sure everything is rock solid before we start on any new big projects.

posts.title: New Mobile Apps
posts.contents:
This is a very exciting day for us! We’ve been hard at work on building a brand new mobile app from scratch. After 6 months, 51 beta updates, and with the help of 72 patient beta testers, it’s finally ready for full release!

For this first version of the new mobile app we focused on reimplementing the existing features and design, but in a much higher quality package. So it looks and works mostly the same as the old version but is faster, smoother, and less buggy. From here we can make it even faster, rethink the design, and quickly add lots of new features.


Download iOS App

Download Android

What’s New

  • Faster load time
  • Smoother interaction
  • Better and less buggy typing experience
  • Supports editing of text in items with dates, emails, or files
  • Swipe menus are more intuitive
  • Emails are sized to fit the screen and support zooming
  • Overall less buggy

Web / Desktop Changes

We’ve been pretty quiet on the blog here because we’ve been working on this huge project for so long. But we have released some important features and fixes along the way. You can see the changelog for the full details of all the updates, but here are the major changes from the past few months:

  • Lots of improvements to sync stability, calendar views, and copy/paste
  • The add item popup now has document and calendar selectors
  • Sharing a document with a non-Moo.do user will send an email inviting them to collaborate on the document
  • A new view for Deleted Items to browse and undelete them
  • A maximize button on the email compose window

Technical Details

The previous app was a mobile web app in a native wrapper. It was generally fine, but there were some editing bugs that were impossible to solve within the constraints of a mobile web app. So we built the new app in React Native, which allowed us to reuse much of the same code, although we had to rebuild the user interface and a lot of the app’s core from scratch. And along the way we also converted the whole codebase to TypeScript and ES2018, so it is much cleaner and easier to extend.

Next up

We’ll be focusing on stability and bug-fixing to make sure everything feels great before starting on any new big projects.

Talk to us

If you want to get involved in shaping Moo.do’s direction, join our active beta community or just email us.
